author: Peter C
comment: Does exactly what it says it will and does it with a simple, logical and uncluttered interface. Just used the app to diagnose a charging problem with my galaxy tab. When using, the device would discharge faster than the charger could recharge. Turns out it was the cheap usb charging cable that i bought of amazon. Swapped to a different cable and the charge current tripled. I would never have found that without this app.

Fantastic!  Does what it says and it has an amazing level of options! In addition to all the charging methods it was previously able to detect, it now also detects Motorola Turbo charging. The only thing I could possibly want that this app does not have is to be able to determine charge rates of Moto Mods but that may be we'll be inside.  *I would like it to detect when it's charging up in Moto mod in the "Charge Rate" section but I realize that's a lot too ask as the target audience would be comparatively small.  Thank you for a great app. Job well done. Very well done.

author: John Gosling
comment: I've just always had it on my phones, since... I think around the time the app went up. It services one specific technical need and it does it well. If you need to know the details of what's going on with the interplay of your battery, chargers, and phone, then this is the tool to use. There's always room to improve, logs for better diagnostics would help, but I love it as is.

author: Michael Schrody
comment: Very useful to determine battery health and troubleshooting, if you know what you're looking for and know how to interpret the readings. For example, as your battery ages, current will increase, being relatively higher for a moderate load, as compared to a new battery. This is actually a function of the voltage drop resulting from increasing internal resistance of the battery.

author: Mike Ro
comment: Shows me mAmp/hour charge rate and other useful stats. Easy to read and allowed me to ID charging rate issue as poor electrical contact in USB socket on tablet (not wires or battery as many forum inhabitants suggested). There's no substitute for good data in analysis. Garbage in=Garbage out. Now sorted this issue. Thanks Guys

author: Taufik Jatmiko
comment: Used to be good. I've paid for no ads since 29.09.2017, but suddenly now my widget locked again, and I must pay again for no ads. Why??    I only have a single account in my device, the account I used to purchase before. I tried to reinstall but still not work.   Now it all set..!

reply.author: Braintrapp
reply.content: If you have more than one accounts on your device then please install Ampere with the account (selected in Google Play) which was used for the purchase.

author: Benny Maisa
comment: I think I solved the problem after I activate persistent notification. Here is bug I found later: --> Last update has one mayor bug. It always shows below 360 mAh even my phone on quick charging. In another word, my phone charges normally, but this app doesn't show actual mAh like usual. <--

author: Bruce Rounthwaite
comment: Great concept! Love where it's going. 2 things bug me tho, it only takes readings while screen is on, & how much is paid version (one tends to like to know these things before one authorises payments.......)  Hmmmn

author: Albert Frank
comment: Straightforward app that tells me what I want to know about my tablet's power. Very useful for seeing how well tha charging cables are working. I appreciate that the developer didn't throw in graphs and other unnecessary bells and whistles.

I paid for an ad free version of this app and when I run it it still won't run until I deal with an annoying nag screen about leaving a review.  You're that desperate for a review? Fine, here's your one star  review.

author: Dennis Sparger
comment: Great saver of time.  We have 5 or 6 chargers and found that 3 of them were useless and the same thing with the cables (small diameter).  With the information your app gave me, I had the courage to toss the suspect hardware.  Thanks

author: Chris Jones
comment: Edit: Since the latest update Ampere now displays my LG G3 charging/discharging at either 10mA or 20mA, both of which are wrong and far too low. Unfortunately at the moment the app has become unusable for me.  t's a good app. I'm not sure how accurate the amp readings are but this will depend on your device. On my LG G3 for instance I suspect Ampere is deriving it's measurements from /sys/class/power_supply/battery/current_now, some of the readings from that file occasionally show my phone charging at up to 30A! Also the app was recently showing my phone allegedly charging at 2.5A on a 2A charger which is obviously unlikely to be accurate. But these are sensor or kernel issues, not really the app's fault and the readings I get from the app are good enough to tell if a charger/cable is significantly faster/slower than another one.

author: Yudhi Aksara
comment: Now it works perfectly. I might be misused other Google account for installing so my purchase can't be restored. After reinstalling using the right account now it works like a charm. Thanks Dev, sorry for last two stars

reply.author: Braintrapp
reply.content: If you have more than one account on your phone you also need to install Ampere with the account (select it in the google play before installing Ampere) which is/was your purchasing account. Please delete Ampere and install it again with the correct account.

author: David Lukacs
comment: It told me exactly what I wanted to know.   Charge current.  I had a faulty usb lead.

author: Stephen Nix
comment: Many chargers and/or power bricks do not provide the full 1800 ma to my Galaxy Note 3, this app tells me which adapters not use if u want to charge my phone in the shortest time.  Helped me determine that the replacement Samsung chargers we're fake or not.

author: Juver Escolta
comment: Its funny how users believe this app have the capability to actually measure charge current. This app only measures the battery voltage and tries to predict charge current. Some reviewers even use this app to review chargers! Unbelievable..

author: Shahnaz
comment: I am  Ashamed.        I thought this app was Real but...............It was fake because my S5 had a dying battery I used the App to check the health it said  it was Good But the next day I do it again and two hours after doing that  it died this flaw needs to be fixed ASAP But the rest of the app Is Great

author: Soniboy84
comment: Doesn't work. Measured with a voltage/current meter and it had wildly different readings. It sometimes showed 2Amps when the monitor output was only 1.6A. Waste of money, don't bother.

author: 3248Gaming
comment: Nice utility app. I had a cable go bad once and this app really helped me figure it out. Good stuff.

author: Taurus MS Favourites
comment: Now its new update can't tell accurate charging mAh. Kindly improve its bugs...

author: Phillip Bialor
comment: Well worth every cent. Helped me learn all about how my phone was charging, discharging and overheating.

author: EyeOf Dragon
comment: this app gets the job done, 95-97% accurate at charging though we have to consider , we can see only on screen on so charge will definately vary, would love to see charging voltage as well not only the charging amps and battery volts, good work braintrapp team :)

author: Chris Lawlor
comment: Amazing does what it says on the tin. Gives you an accurate read on your battery ma so any problems it will know great app. a must have for every phone

author: Steffan Wennerberg
comment: Gave it 5 stars and paid lic. In 2016. This is Feb. 2018. My Zenfone Zoom app goes through measuring cycle but registers "0" . At least in the past 7 months the app now indicates charging instead of discharging when in fact the phone was charging

author: Mr. Ivan
comment: Not Bad! Please Make Perfectly Works To Enable Feature Support Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 On My Device Xiaomi Mi A1 Upgraded To Android Oreo 8.0.0 (Security Patches 1 February 2018). Thanks a lot. Cheers....!!!

author: Dawayne Plumb
comment: I have enjoyed this app until the update. After update I lost my pro version after purchasing it on August 15th 2017.

reply.author: Braintrapp
reply.content: If you have more than one account on your phone you also need to install Ampere with the account (select it in the google play before installing Ampere) which is/was your purchasing account. Please delete Ampere and install it again with the correct account.

author: Isratul Saifa
comment: It does not tell me the real thing. It just gives us mind made charging rate. It is nothing but cheating. When an ammeter (electric current measuring device) reading is 1000ma, it just shows 740ma.

author: Dankady Bong
comment: Measures the recharge mah but also discharge mah energy use while not charging. the best app of this kind I've found.

author: Eusebi Vidal
comment: Molt bé que estigui en català. Podríeu afegir un apartat explicant quins són els valors normals i a partir de quins ens hauríem de preocupar.

author: Jirang Moon
comment: Simple app, ok for free. Wish it had more features: average, graph,  short term memory...

author: Miguel Rodriguez
comment: Thought my battery was dead but thanks to this I found out that I just had a bad cable.

author: subhajit pal
comment: In Lenovo k8 plus reading is always show the zero. please fix the issue as soon as possible.

author: Krapa Kartik
comment: Add options for the max usb current and charging rate for the nougat and upper Android phones users. These options were there for the marshmallow users. They are of great help, try to add them in the next update.

author: Andrew
comment: Great little app if you doubt any phone chargers or want to know the load being drawn from your battery so you know wether or not another app is sucking too much power.

author: Raw Case
comment: App not measuring battery capacity showing always 0mah while charging

author: ElectricSphere
comment: Really it says 0 mA ,,,,,,, I would say this app isn't compatible in some devices like why I'm using.. Maybe'

author: Adrian Matiut
comment: Used to work great on my Note 5 and LG V10.  On my Note 8 the info icon in the menu bar isn't being displayed, even when the option is selected.
I really recommend this app to everyone who cares how fast there phone is charging and keeps an eye on the life of battery

author: justin schwanger
comment: This app is great I can see what my battery is pulling and what apps are killing it and see if my charger and cords are charging at copacit6

author: Stormie Derr
comment: Use this on all devices and it works flawlessly. Great to make sure my devices are being charged properly and my cables and boxes are working
